snippet: In Tudor Cristian Jurgiu’s first feature film, a Romanian engineer living in Japan takes his family to visit his father, a curmudgeonly widower who has lost everything.
abstract: Ben Kenigsberg reviews Tudor Cristian Jurgiu film The Japanese Dog, starring Victor Rebengiuc.
lead_paragraph: In Tudor Cristian Jurgiu’s first feature film, a Romanian engineer living in Japan takes his family to visit his father, a curmudgeonly widower who has lost everything.

headline.main: Review: ‘The Japanese Dog,’ a Family Reunion in Romania
